page.title: 06Water in the Bodenham area
page.content: The River Lugg is one of the main attractions in Bodenham.The river is the responsibility of the Welsh Water Authority. The manager is Mr C J Jones Fishermen enjoy fishing this length of river because it is well stocked with many different fish including chub, dace, pike, perch, trout and sometimes salmon. The deepest part of the river is 20 feet deep by a place called the Weir House.In the winter the river sometimes floods and covers fields and the road. In the Bodenham area there are 5 miles of river and it provides drinking water, attractive walks along the banks, good fishing, and lots of fun providing care is taken when playing near water. An expanse of water has gathered in the gravel pits.<see page 14 >>
